recommendations.title: Adaptive Theme Based on Time of Day
recommendations.description: Implement a theme system that subtly shifts colors throughout the day: warm dawn tones (5-8am), bright daytime clarity (8am-6pm), deep sunset hues (6-9pm), and starlit midnight (9pm-5am). Each theme maintains the Expedition 33 × Ghibli aesthetic while matching TJ's circadian rhythm.
recommendations.rationale: TJ is a night owl who works evenings. The current static warm theme doesn't reflect his actual working patterns. An adaptive theme would create psychological alignment with his natural energy cycles and make evening work sessions feel more intentional.

code_changes: Create ThemeEngine class with 4 time-based palettes
Detect system dark mode preference as override
Smooth CSS transitions between themes (5s duration)
Store theme preference with timestamp in localStorage

recommendations.impact: High - Psychological alignment with user patterns

recommendations.title: Haptic Feedback Integration
recommendations.description: Add subtle haptic feedback for key actions on mobile devices: completing a task (light tap), adding a priority (double tap), urgent deadline approaching (sharp pulse), successful sync (gentle wave). Falls back to subtle visual pulses on desktop.
recommendations.rationale: The PWA works on mobile but lacks tactile feedback. For TJ who works in cafes/libraries, mobile haptics create a more grounded, physical connection to his digital workspace without visual distraction.

recommendations.title: Living Card Borders
recommendations.description: Add subtle animated gradient borders to priority cards and urgent items that pulse slowly, like breathing. Uses CSS conic-gradient with animation - no JS required for the effect itself.
recommendations.rationale: Creates ambient awareness of what's urgent without demanding attention. The gentle pulse feels organic and alive, fitting the Ghibli-inspired aesthetic.

implementation.code_snippet: @keyframes border-rotate { from { --angle: 0deg; } to { --angle: 360deg; } } .living-border::before { content: ''; position: absolute; inset: -2px; background: conic-gradient(from var(--angle), var(--accent), var(--color-bloom), var(--accent)); animation: border-rotate 4s linear infinite; }

recommendations.title: Smart Contextual Quick Actions
recommendations.description: Replace static quick-add buttons with context-aware suggestions based on: current tab, time of day, recent activity patterns, and upcoming deadlines. For example: in the morning show 'Add today's priority', before meetings show 'Prep notes', on weekends show 'Weekly review'.
recommendations.rationale: Reduces decision fatigue by surfacing the most likely next action. The dashboard becomes proactively helpful rather than passively waiting for input.

implementation.display_location: Floating action button with expanding menu

recommendations.title: Intelligent Deadline Extraction from Notes
recommendations.description: Parse the Notes tab for dates, deadlines, and action items, automatically suggesting tasks and calendar events. Uses natural language processing to find patterns like 'apply by March 15' or 'meeting next Tuesday at 2pm'.
recommendations.rationale: TJ uses the Notes tab for unstructured thoughts. Automatically extracting actionable items prevents things from slipping through cracks - a key risk noted in USER.md. This bridges his calendar-only preference with the capture-everything reality.

implementation.ui_flow: When Notes is saved, scan → show notification 'Found 3 potential deadlines' → click to review → add to tasks/calendar
implementation.model: Can run locally with compromise.js (140KB) or use regex-based approach

recommendations.impact: High - Prevents items slipping through cracks

recommendations.title: Constellation Health Score
recommendations.description: Calculate and display an overall 'Constellation Health' metric based on: average connection strength, contact recency, balance of node types, and response patterns. Shows trend over time and suggests actions to strengthen weak connections.
recommendations.rationale: TJ's network (Serena, Flora, Alex) is documented as critical support infrastructure. Quantifying relationship health makes the abstract concrete and prompts maintenance before connections atrophy.

scoring_algorithm.type_balance: presence of anchor + grounding + growth nodes = 20 points

implementation.visualization: Radial gauge in Command tab below Constellation Map
implementation.suggestions: 'Serena hasn't been contacted in 12 days — send a message?'

recommendations.title: Grant Opportunity Scraper
recommendations.description: Background service that periodically checks configured grant sources (OTF, Hamilton Community Foundation, etc.) for new opportunities matching TJ's profile. Stores results in Intel with 'grant' category and calculates match score based on eligibility criteria.
recommendations.rationale: Grants are a major part of TJ's work (Firebird, OPLA). Manually checking multiple sources is tedious and opportunities can be missed. Automated discovery ensures he sees relevant opportunities early.

implementation.fallback: Manual 'Check for grants' button if background sync fails

recommendations.title: Voice Memo Quick Capture
recommendations.description: Add a microphone button that records short voice memos, transcribes them using Web Speech API, and adds to Notes or creates tasks. Useful for capturing thoughts while walking or when typing is inconvenient.
recommendations.rationale: TJ follows a Walking Protocol. Voice capture during walks enables idea capture without stopping to type. The transcribed text can then be processed by the deadline extraction feature.

implementation.fallback: MediaRecorder API storing audio blobs if transcription unavailable
implementation.output: Transcribed text appended to Notes with [Voice: timestamp] prefix
implementation.privacy: All processing client-side, nothing sent to servers

recommendations.title: IndexedDB Migration for Large Data
recommendations.description: Migrate from localStorage to IndexedDB for: LLM logs (unlimited growth), activity feed (append-only), and file cache (BrainSync). localStorage remains for small config items only. Implement with idb-keyval wrapper for async API.
recommendations.rationale: localStorage has ~5-10MB limit and is synchronous (blocks UI). TJ's usage will eventually hit this limit. IndexedDB provides 50MB+ with async operations, better for the growing activity and sync data.

implementation.migration_strategy: On boot, check for localStorage data → migrate to IndexedDB → clear localStorage → set migration flag

recommendations.impact: Medium - Prevents data loss, improves performance

recommendations.title: Request Interception and Caching
recommendations.description: Implement a Service Worker strategy that caches Notion API responses and serves stale-while-revalidate. Reduces load times and enables offline viewing of synced data.
recommendations.rationale: TJ works in cafes with potentially spotty WiFi. Currently, losing connection means losing access to Notion-synced data. Stale-while-revalidate ensures the app always shows something useful.

implementation.fallback: Show 'Last synced X ago' banner when serving cached
implementation.update_sw: Modify sw.js to add this caching strategy

recommendations.title: Anxious Nomad Content Pipeline
recommendations.description: Dedicated integration for TJ's Substack publication. Track draft ideas → writing → published posts, cross-reference with content calendar, and calculate publishing streak. Pull in newsletter metrics if Substack API allows.
recommendations.rationale: Anxious Nomad Collective is listed as a personal project in USER.md. Treating it with the same seriousness as work projects validates its importance and helps maintain consistency.

implementation.dashboard_widget: Mini view in Today tab showing 'Current streak: X days' or 'Draft in progress'
implementation.substack_api: Check if Substack has RSS or API for published posts

recommendations.title: MetricsHealth Metrics Dashboard (Privacy-Preserving)
recommendations.description: Create a dedicated tab or view for TJ's work at MetricsHealth that pulls ONLY non-sensitive metrics: hours logged, projects completed, skills utilized. No client data, no revenue figures. Provides sense of professional progress without violating privacy constraints.
recommendations.rationale: USER.md explicitly flags MetricHealth as private and never to be discussed. However, tracking personal professional growth there is valuable. This balances privacy with self-awareness.

implementation.data_source: Manual entry or simple API that only exports: hours, project count, completed tasks
implementation.access_control: Require explicit enable in settings, default disabled

recommendations.impact: Medium - Professional growth tracking without privacy risk

creative_surprises.title: The Library Whisperer Badge
creative_surprises.concept: Gamification element for TJ's library work. Earn badges for: cataloging 100 items, helping a patron find exactly what they need, mastering a new system. The badge appears in the constellation visualization as a new node type: achievement.
creative_surprises.implementation: Add 'achievements' array to constellation data. Each achievement has icon, title, date earned, criteria. Display as small stars around the main constellation. First badge: 'First Day' earned when marking a meeting with Hamilton Library as completed.
creative_surprises.why: Brings joy to work that can feel invisible. Validating the day-to-day victories.

creative_surprises.title: Seasonal Constellation Shifts
creative_surprises.concept: The background starfield subtly changes with the seasons: winter shows Orion prominently, spring features Leo, summer has the Summer Triangle, autumn displays Pegasus. The stars TJ sees in the app mirror the stars he'd see outside in Barrie, Ontario.
creative_surprises.implementation: Use Date to determine season → load different star positions in the .stars CSS. Could use actual star catalog data simplified, or artistic representations. Add a 'What's in the sky tonight?' tooltip on the starfield.
creative_surprises.why: Connects digital space to physical place. Grounds TJ in his actual location.

creative_surprises.title: The Unsent Letter Draft
creative_surprises.concept: A special private space in Notes for letters TJ needs to write but may never send: to immigration officials who denied a visa, to family far away, to his future self. These are encrypted locally and marked with a special icon. A way to process emotion without it being 'productivity'.
creative_surprises.implementation: Add section in Notes with divider: '--- Unsent Letters ---'. Add simple XOR encryption with user's own passphrase. Visual indicator: sealed envelope icon. Not included in regular notes search unless specifically enabled.
creative_surprises.why: TJ's immigration stress needs an outlet that isn't task-oriented. This creates space for emotional processing within the system.
